content.rendered:
Nanny Placement Services for New York’s Busiest Families

You seek enthusiasm, developmental knowledge, high EQ, a finger on the pulse, eyes in the back of heads, and playtime experts (of course). Check, check and check! You make your list, we’ll check it not only twice, but countless times to ensure that you’re matched not just with a nanny, but with the best nanny for your family.

Get Started

A helping hand precisely where and when you need it most.

Hiring a nanny is a big decision. High-quality care at home allows you to live and work without worry knowing that your children’s days are safe, happy and secure. Quality time for busy parents is limited so enjoy those brief moments knowing tasks are complete and your children are in hands that mirror your style, hopes and preferences – every day!

Why NbN?

Our scope of dedicated childcare services include:

  • Full-Time/Part-Time Nanny

  • Temporary Nanny

  • Weekend Nanny

  • Night Nanny

  • Summer Nanny

  • Governess

  • Newborn Care Specialist

  • After School Nanny

  • Special Needs Nanny

  • Nanny / Family Assistant

  • Live-in & Live-out Care

  • Travel Nanny

and beyond...

Find Your Nanny
Find Your Family

NbN'S STANDARDS OF CARE

What do we look for?

On average, only the top 2% of talent are accepted into our network. We set a high bar for representation to our client families in the New York and Tri-State area. Our vetting process extends way beyond the typical background checks because we believe that it’s more than years on the job that makes you a standout professional!

Authorization to work in the United States.

Minimum of 5 years experience as a full-time nanny or a steady part-time nanny.

Compassionate, well-suited demeanor for working with children.

Exceptional childcare references which attest to strong communication skills, reliability, punctuality, maturity, and the highest emotional intelligence.

Ability to commit to a minimum of 1 year for all long-term positions.

Education or proven knowledge & experience with children's growth & development

Readiness to help with light housekeeping and all childcare-related tasks ie: meal prep, organizing, laundry, homework, etc…

Pass a comprehensive background check.

A polished and professional appearance.

A thorough communication assessment including oral and written English fluency along with email proficiency.

Enhanced qualifications are also available, including…

  • Special training & certifications, e.g. first aid, CPR & AED, early childhood education, defensive driving, water safety certification, Newborn Care, etc.
  • Four-year accredited university degree and beyond.
  • Driver’s license.
  • Special needs experience, including Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) Speech/ Occupational therapy.
  • Flexible schedule & ability to travel (not an enhanced qualification but sought).
  • Fluency in additional languages.
  • Willingness to live-in during the summer months and during periods of travel (not an enhanced qualification but sought).
  • Ability to cover occasional late night and/or overnight needs (not an enhanced qualification but sought).
  • Experience in Kosher homes.

No compromises, no cutting corners.

(just crusts… and only by request)

We don’t offer passive care. Our nannies are not transactional, not filling a gap year, not babysitting and not punching out the clock. They have chosen childcare for all the right reasons and have proven themselves to have the correct dispositions to work in private family homes. Our deeply insightful evaluation and three-level interview process is designed to spotlight those nannies who represent the best-of-the-best and are truly NbN material.

Find Your Nanny

What Our Families Are Saying

I highly recommend this agency...
We hired our nanny 8 months ago and she continues to work with us. We are thrilled with our nanny and the seamless process of finding out incredible nanny through this agency.Noor N. | Parent
NbN is amazing and found exactly what we needed…
NbN is amazing and found exactly what we needed… They listen and offer helpful advice and a very personalized experience. Their backgrounds as a nannies and a moms makes their perspective invaluable.Thank you!Brittany M. | Parent
NbN does a great job listening...
to what you want/need in a position and matches you accordingly. They are invested in finding the right fit between nannies and families and not just randomly putting people togetherEl G. | Parent
I was impressed by their high quality profiles…
and very thorough and personalized choice for a bit of a "unicorn" search. Highly recommend!Caroline H. | Parent
I could not have asked for a better experience...
NbN was kind and patient while my husband and I decided what we were looking for and accommodated our requests perfectly. They were quick and found three prospective nannies for us to interview in just a few days.Georgia N. | Parent
Nannies by Noa was by far the best…
All of the candidates we saw from them were thoughtful, empathic, hard-working, fun, friendly people -- and we quickly found the person we wanted to hire. She has really changed our lives and our kids' lives. Totally worth it.Eli P. | Parent
I can't say enough good things about this nanny agency...
NbN operates with such integrity and genuinely cares about each and every family they serve. Believe me when I say that if you are looking for the best nannies in NY, you will be in great hands with Nannies By Noa! Rosalind P. | Parent
They helped us find the perfect nanny…
We spent over an hour talking to me about my needs, my children, our family and they helped us find the perfect nanny! They showed attention to detail and care for both us and the nanny!Katayoun A. | Parent

Now Offering Newborn Care Services

The City may never sleep, but you can...

with our Newborn Care Support.

Those first precious days go by in the blink of an eye. Breathe, rest, recover, and enjoy every precious moment as you ease into parenthood with your new little one – all while enjoying the skilled and gentle support of our newborn care specialists.

Learn More
Join Our Network

Our Proven Process in a New York Minute

01

Let’s start at the very beginning.

Complete our simple form to begin the process and we’ll schedule a complimentary call to talk about your family’s needs.

02

We make your list & check it twice.

If we’re the right fit, we’ll take a deep dive on a consultation call. Tell us your wish list, and we’ll do the rest!

03

Say yes to the very best.

We’ll connect you with not only New York’s savviest and most dedicated care providers, but the best of the best!

04

Interviewed, trialed, ready to hire?

We’ll help you define an offer & work agreement that sets up a strong foundation and incentivizes longevity and transparency.

Find Your Nanny
Find Your Family

An Investment In Your Family

Choosing quality childcare is an investment in your child’s future.

Much like choosing the right schools, teachers and influencers, choosing a nanny means selecting a role model for a large part of your child’s life, one who’ll be a primary guide in their continued development, emotional growth, and happiness.

You can expect to invest:

  • We charge a one-time, non-refundable $400 engagement fee to initiate your search.
  • Live-out Placement – 15% of nanny’s gross annual earnings for long-term (3+ months).
  • Live-in Placement – 20% of nanny’s gross annual earnings for long-term (3+ months).
  • Temporary Hires – 25% of nanny’s gross earnings for the employment period covered (1–3 months).
  • Newborn Care – 25% of the NCS’s gross earnings for the employment period covered.
Find Your Nanny
Find Your Family

Parenting is full of questions…

Thankfully, we have some of the answers.

​​If my nanny calls out sick, do you offer backup care?

Our focus at NBN is to provide your long-term solution but we can point you in the right direction for backup care should you need it.

How does your replacement policy work?

Even in a perfect placement, the unexpected can arise. Our 90-day credit replacement policy for permanent hires is there for you in that event. We will do all we can to provide a suitable replacement candidate should you need to terminate employment or the nanny resigns her position.

What are your placement fees?

Bespoke placement is both time and labor intensive. We charge a one-time, non-refundable $400 engagement fee to initiate your search.

  • Live-out Placement – 15% of nanny’s gross annual earnings for long-term (3+ months).
  • Live-in Placement – 20% of nanny’s gross annual earnings for long-term (3+ months).
  • Temporary Hires – 25% of nanny’s gross earnings for the employment period covered (1–3 months).
  • Newborn Care – 25% of the NCS’s gross earnings for the employment period covered.

What are typical nanny rates?

Hourly rates in NYC vary greatly based on experience, education, special skills, additional languages, and each position’s level of responsibility. Given the caliber of candidates we represent, we typically see gross hourly rates of $30-$35+ per hour.

My friend pays her sitter $25/hr. Why are your rates higher?

There are some common misconceptions about what a sitter can offer and the gifts and support a great nanny will bring to your family. To better understand the differences, please see our Babysitter vs. Nanny Resource Sheet.

How do I pay my nanny?

The nanny is your employee; therefore, you are responsible for all applicable taxes and withholdings. Nannies are paid an hourly rate and receive their compensation weekly. As the employer, you pay the nanny directly. We do not take any part of the nanny’s compensation.

Can I pay my nanny under the table?

If your childcare provider earns in excess of your state’s annual earnings threshold for tax withholdings, you are required by Federal law to withhold taxes by filing a W2. Not doing so puts your family at risk of serious legal implications. Let us put you in touch with our payroll partners at GTM to keep your family safe, and your nanny receiving professional legal employment.

Do I have to pay my nanny’s taxes?

Every family who decides to hire a nanny is responsible for any applicable tax, withholding, and reporting. Please see Tax & Payroll Services to find information on your tax obligations as a domestic employer.

Where do you find your nannies?

Great Nannies often come our way via word of mouth referrals, many return to us as their contract term ends and they seek new employment and others we source through a variety of well-established industry resources and job boards. In the end though, wherever we meet candidates, they must all go through the exact same recruitment and evaluation process- every time!

How do you screen your nannies?

All applicants are screened in an in-depth 3-part interview process, with 3 individual team members to gain a broad perspective of skills, professionalism, knowledge, communication, acceptance of feedback, and the desired demeanor for childcare.

We speak with and cross-reference, a minimum of 2 previous employers to assess past performance (Past performance is the best indicator of future performance). Along with public social media reviews.

When do you run background checks and what do you check?

We know safety is your priority; It’s ours too. Our background checks are the most comprehensive available in our industry. We check to a federal level: identity research, multijurisdictional criminal records database, county-of-residence criminal research, state level criminal record and sex offender research, federal district criminal research.

A la carte options are also available upon request such as: education verification, employment history, CPO’s (civil protective orders) international criminal checks, and 10-panel drug screening. Need a check that you don’t see listed? Just ask!

Due to NYC’s ‘Fair Chance Act’, we are no longer able to run or disclose any criminal background check information, including motor vehicle checks (in NYC) on any applicant prior to receipt of an accepted, conditional offer of employment.

What benefits should I provide my nanny?

What is mandated by law vs. what’s the industry standard? We’ll walk you through this step by step during your consultation call so you can customize a compensation package that incentivizes top talent and fits your budget. In general, nannies seek 2 weeks of annual paid vacation, sick/ personal days, major federal holidays and commuter/ travel stipends. Families sometimes offer Health Insurance packages or stipends. Talk to us about a tax-free health care reimbursement for your nanny- it’s a valuable incentive!

Are you insured?

We are licensed by the Department of Consumer Affairs (license # 2017000-DCA) and are bonded and insured.

Your children are your whole world!

A great nanny acts as an extension of you in your absence, supporting your values and preferences, and aligning with your parenting style and philosophies to provide a secure, safe, and united home for your family.

Find Your Nanny
Find Your Family
